Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Alan Jones
Reviews.Content: This is my first personal laptop, and I'm happy with the purchase.  It's good looking and fast.  My only complaint is with Microsoft.  They are trying to make their operating system and internet browser cleaner looking and more intuitive.  Sometimes I'd rather have my options visible and let me do the thinking rather than thinking for me.  That's not the fault of the computer though, and I'll get used to it eventually.

Reviews.Title: Her name is Elphaba... I Love my Lenovo!
Reviews.Author: Boshemia "Boshemia"
Reviews.Content: Just a few chapters away from the finish line on my first book and my old nasty broke laptop quit, then another shorted out, then another could no longer run OpenOffice. It was dire.I wanted to wait until I could afford a higher end laptop but I ended up taking a shot on this Lenovo. I needed something that could handle my workload. Writing, editing, graphics, websites, social networking... and I needed one that could do it all at once.Elphaba will be my faithful muse while I make my writing dreams come true!Great computer, everything was set up and running right away. No issues of any sort. So happy with her.Special Non Lenovo Note: Window 8 is a demon from the pit of hell. It literally made me cry. Thankfully I was able to run a windows shell and get my desktop back. Still haven't been able to deactivate the "charms" bar. It makes my writing life a living hell, and graphics... ughh.Back to Lenovo. It makes Windows 8 almost bearable. Everything is running smoothly. Fast, clean, and good price too. My book is back on track.Oh, and why did I name her Elpahaba?I plan to defy gravity silly!

Reviews.Title: Lenovo is top quality
Reviews.Author: aw10008
Reviews.Content: The laptop is light and has a raised keyboard for easy typing.  All the features are excellent and you are not going to get a better laptop in this price range.

Reviews.Title: I Love It Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Maliq Roberson
Reviews.Content: I really love this product this is my first laptop and its fast and just what i was looking for.Windows 8 is great with keeping things organized and keeps it running smoothly.Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Be going strong
Reviews.Author: J.A.Crumley "JA"
Reviews.Content: We bought this to use for work.  Had it traveling and connecting wirelessly at the office.  So far it's been doing great.  A little heavy if you're used to Ultrabooks, but a solid laptop so far.

Reviews.Title: Lenova G585
Reviews.Author: granny47
Reviews.Content: It was a birthday gift for my college student son and he loves it! He uses it for school everyday!

Reviews.Title: Very slow, almost unusable
Reviews.Author: Ellery
Reviews.Content: I needed a computer because I've been using my iPad as my main computer, and I was getting tired of really only being able to use one app at a time and by the word processing functions on it. I sold the iPad and I purchased the Lenovo G585 because the price point was good, particularly with the specs included, and because of the good reviews.It ended up being a bad decision. It is near impossible to watch a streaming video without it being patchy in either the video or sound, even with no other programs or windows open. It's very frustrating, since I don't have a TV and would want to watch Hulu or Netlflix, and it makes it difficult with Facebook or Youtube videos. Even gifs don't display properly or smoothly. Regular webpages without any media content also display that "patchy" behavior, where it gets stuck in places when you're trying to scroll and even the text you are typing does not show up evenly. Pages take quite a bit to load and forget about trying to open up multiple tabs on a web browser. My first day using it, I had IE and Spotify open and it froze and crashed. I haven't even tried installing most of the apps I'd like to have, including Word, because I know it will just be frustrating.I am told it's quite possibly a Windows 8 problem, but this computer doesn't come with a Windows 7 downgrade and I'm not willing to spend more money on an installation CD. On top of that, Windows 8 is pretty frustrating to use. I'm returning the computer, and I hope I can warn some others to not waste their time.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo Good!  Windows 8 - Not so Much
Reviews.Author: James "2020 In a blink"
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my wife for her birthday a while ago.  After realizing that Windows 8 is set up as if it was being used on a mobile device, she became a little more accepting of the product.  The problem, of course, is that absent swipe actions on the screen (the screen is not set up to be touch sensitive), the operating system becomes a pain in the neck.  It appears as if Microsoft is again trying to press the world into it's vision of what hardware should be present in a system, rather than writing software to work with the hardware that is in place.  Some things never change.The other major problem is that the computer 'jumps' as she is typing (according to her). In trying to find out what she was talking about, and after attempting various searches on the net, it appears that the touch pad is too sensitive, and if she happens to double tap it while typing it will take her to whatever place the system assumed the cursor was on at the time the double tap was interpreted. We are still working through this one, but I think she may be able to turn the touchpad on an off with a Fn F8 combination.Finally, the system came with a ridiculous amount of bloatware, and in the first hour she was using it the processor was pegged as it attempted to bring all kinds of extraneous crap up to date - and of course, bring Windows 8 up to the latest version according to the mother ship in Redmond.When will manufacturers get smart and start building systems that don't have to be upgraded every two weeks?  When I was growing up nobody ever told me I had to upgrade my TV set.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for a fair price!
Reviews.Author: Caroline
Reviews.Content: It is a good laptop, for a fair price. Everything is working according to expectations. The only drawback (I guess is my fault for not having it checked before) is the fact that it doesn't come with HDMI port. It is such a basic connection for an eletronic equipment nowadays. Especially because I am talking about a notebook with USB 3.0 ports, what is a nice feature!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this junk
Reviews.Author: Alex Hilsenrath
Reviews.Content: I bought this a year ago. It froze constantly and stuttered. Within three weeks it broke completely whereupon I took it to a repair store that told me it had been sold to me with a fault hard drive. No worries, I had a six month warranty so I gave it to Lenovo to fix. They took 40 days. To replace a hard drive. If they had just mailed me the component it would have taken me 20 minutes. In the meantime the warranty specified I'd receive a replacement computer but they didn't give me one. Eventually they gave in to my persistence and gave me one but it was amazingly worse than the machine itself and broke after four days whereupon they gave me a Mac that was beautiful and worked amazingly. I wish I'd been allowed to keep that one. Two weeks later my old machine was fixed and returned to me.So it worked, kind of, for three months, then broken again, this time the frame itself. The hinge clean snapped and again, it took around a month to repair. They gave me a half-decent replacement straightaway this time.Once again it kept working until recently, where we returned to problem (1) except I'm not sure it's the hard drive because I'm not going to bother repairing it, I'm going to buy a different make of laptop in the sales.Summary: if this machine were being offered for free and it were a 20 minute walk from your place, you'd still be wasting your time by getting it. It is an aggravating piece of mass-produced Chinese junk and according to the CIA and MI6 it's a threat to your security: [...]I will never buy a Lenovo product again. This has been a waste of my time and money and it's not even particularly cheap.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 stinks but puter ok
Reviews.Author: Jeff Valero
Reviews.Content: Other than reformatting the laptop because win8 is terrible the laptop is good for basic web searches and such.  Do not expect a super computer because it is not such.  The good is that it has a super easy to the touch keyboard and the screen has pretty good brightness and also good resolution.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: S. Flynn
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something economical and easy to use. Very happy with performance. My old laptop got very warm and the battery didn't last long. I am very impressed that this laptop exceeds my expectations. The mouse is a bit touchy. And if you slide your hands just right it pulls up screens unintentionally or zooms in or out when your not trying to. I played with the settings a bit and got to a comfortable place.Decent computer, fair price.

Reviews.Title: An Entry Level Laptop?
Reviews.Author: Toby Nixon
Reviews.Content: After having this laptop for three months, I can tell you it's awesome. Once you get rid of the OEM software, including McAfee and shutting off the unnecessary services, it's a great laptop.This runs the games I want to play, emulators, Wireshark and network tools.This is a big step up from a Netbook, the only problem is that it's not a touchscreen. But for someone who isn't on top of the games, you should get an Alienware or some specific gaming computer.If you are buying for a friend who makes things, videos, plays with emulators, Virtual Machines and dual boot... You will love this computer.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: shamrock reader
Reviews.Content: Ordered two of these for my children.  It is great for them to Skype and play games.  Minecraft, Wizard 101, and lots of apps work great on it.  We put Microsoft Office on it so they are able to type school papers.  I would order this computer again.  Great value!

Reviews.Title: Had a screen issue.
Reviews.Author: Gloria
Reviews.Content: I chose this laptop because I have a desktop Lenovo also and have no problems with it. I guess things can't always be as perfect as we like.

Reviews.Title: Good, solid laptop
Reviews.Author: Bert Brandt
Reviews.Content: Excellent product.  Probably a 4.5 rating at the price i paid.  It's the second lenovo laptop in the house, and both are well made.  When the price is this low, you can't expect perfection, so the only complaints are that sometimes it is sluggish, and Windows 8 is not the friendliest of programs.  (Can't wait for 8.1.)

Reviews.Title: Lenovo G585 15.6-inch laptop
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Hall
Reviews.Content: I ordered this laptop for my wife.  Everything was delivered, in good condition, within the scheduled time.  My wife has been using our old desktop (Windows XP) to get on the internet or play games while I used my laptop (Windows 7) in another room.  She wanted to be in the same room and still have something to do.  It took a little time to get to know Windows 8, but this had nothing to do with the computer.  She has been able to get on the internet with Wi-Fi and find whatever she is looking for.  It also has been good for the games she plays.  For a low priced laptop, both of us are well pleased. Looking forward to many years use for her.

Reviews.Title: ordered a used  and got a new older version
Reviews.Author: gameov1
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Lenovo G585 and got the G580 but a brand new laptop. However it was a switch up I still keep the one I received and I can say I am happy. I had it a month in a half and I haven't had no problems.

Reviews.Title: Pretty awesome for a basic laptop!
Reviews.Author: Andrew Sheehan
Reviews.Content: After having this laptop for 2 weeks now, I haven't had any issues with it! Fist thing I did when I got it was I made a system image of Windows 8, then downloaded the drivers and installed windows 7.  In order for you to put Windows 7 on here you have to go into the BIOS and enable "leagcy OS" then "legacy mode" under the Sata controller. That's how I got Windows 7 to install. It has been a descent laptop for all my basic on the go task, and school work. You can play some games on here that are older but don't expect this to play any 2013 titles at highest settings. lol. I have my desktop for that.  If you want a in expensive reliable laptop for basic and some very light gaming (like facebook games etc)and work on the go, this is the laptop for you!

Reviews.Title: love my lenovo
Reviews.Author: teresa ray
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop. this my first laptop and this the best product I have ever used the features are easy to use and understand keep up the good work..

Reviews.Title: Sadly, it could happen to you too.
Reviews.Author: Romain étudie
Reviews.Content: This is the story of a defective support service, 6 hard disk drives and an empty box.Back in April 2013, I acquired a Lenovo laptop (about $900), directly from the Lenovo.com site. Everything works satisfactorily until 4 months later. The laptop wouldn't boot and the error message points at a hard disk drive failure.Request #1: A quick and pleasant call to Lenovo and, two days later, I receive a replacement drive and reinstallation DVDs. The hard drive is used, below the specification of my previous drive... and started to fail noisily in the middle of the reinstallation procedure!Request #2: Calling Lenovo and asking for another drive, which I receive promptly. I install the drive (used parts and below specs again), turn the laptop on and... What's that horrible whining sound?! Conclusion: Yet another failed disk. And to be sure of my diagnostic, I extract an old drive from an old laptop. I successfully reinstall my Lenovo laptop and the old drive.Request #3: Calling Lenovo again. They want me to return the laptop. I make sure they understand the nature of the problem, why returning the laptop makes little sense and why I expect a drive with, at least, the same specifications as the one I originally bought. A week later, the promised drive wasn't there yet (and actually never arrived).Request #4: On the phone with Lenovo... They don't know what happened to the previous drive. They'll send a new one, with the right specifications. I didn't bother opening the drive when I received it, it wasn't the right kind!!! In the meantime, tired of waiting, I had bought a new drive at a local store. Unsurprisingly, it did wonder in my laptop.Request #5: Moving online to avoid being impolite on the phone. There, I go through a weird registration and realized all the limit of their support tools. I almost feel sad for the support people working there. I try my best to describe all the extent of my issues with Lenovo. The field limit to 150 characters don't help, at all. My request: A real solution, in the form of a real drive or a real check to cover the purchase of a new real drive. And, a couple of days later, I receive... an empty box?? After some head-scratching, I understand they want me to return my laptop... #FacePalm!!! It's time to share my story with the Amazonians.Request #6: I'll get to that as soon as I'm done posting this story. I'll update the post if anything interesting happens.If you ever buy the laptop you're looking at, I wish you good luck!------------------------------------[Update: 07/09/2013, Lenovo sent another empty box :-((( I'm done with them! This is absolutely hopeless!]

Reviews.Title: Keys stuck.
Reviews.Author: Treydizzle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a Birthday gift for a friend around may 20 2013. By july 10 2013 the Y key, and I think 2 more are stuck, and won't work. Not sure what is wrong. Just got it back from my friend, I am going to have it fixed since it was a gift, and didn't last much over a month. Amazon won't give me my money back, not all of it anyway, they only warranty this laptop for 30 days, of course it lasted about 33 days. A different friend of mine has a Lenovo, and loves it, I purchased this one based on his high regard for the one he owns, but this one sucks. In defense of the computer, maybe it was something that happened during shipping, I don't know. Either way, with only a 30 day return policy, I won't be purchasing any expensive electronics from Amazon ever again. I expected 90 days, I'm sure with a receipt Wal mart would give 90. So I'll go there from now on. Oh yeah, Amazon did say I could return it, but not for a full refund, and I'd have to pay shipping. Very displeased, by the computer, and Amazon's policy. I give it 2 stars only because I feel half the problem was Amazon, if they had a proper return policy, I'd give it 1 star. Or 5 if they gave me another one that lasted over a month.

Reviews.Title: Very Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: If you have a lot of time to sit and wait for your computer to function and do basic tasks, them this LENOVO is for you. I have gone gray waiting for this thing to load programs. It is NOT  worth the money. I didn't want to spend a lot, I figured to use this for typing estimates, basic internet searches and email. I'm regretting my purchase, stay away and spend a few more dollars, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Rachael
Reviews.Content: You can never go wrong with Lenovo. This laptop is beautiful and durable. Comes with windows 8, which is the only downside.

Reviews.Title: WAY. TOO. SLOW.  Don't bother.
Reviews.Author: idehaemer
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 as gifts for my children.  They are expensive paperweights.  The processor speed for the internet is not functional.  It takes 20 minutes to connect, and then one character per 3 seconds will appear in your browser window as you type. USELESS USELESS USELESS.  If you still want one after reading this review, let me know.  I will sell them for cheap cheap cheap.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Felix G.
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much for the item, im so happy with it and hope to get more item later. appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: excellent laptop...
Reviews.Author: daniel
Reviews.Content: as expected even better than I thought, thank you .. very good quality product ... thanks for fulfilling my expectations .. thank you very much ..

Reviews.Title: A piece of junk !
Reviews.Author: GICU
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop in on Black Friday 2012 at Best Buy in Canada. Paid $310 with taxes included. At that time I owned a Acer Atom notebook I bought back in 2009 and except the inconvenience of small 10'' screen and the lack of DVD DRIVE,  that little notebook always performed as it shoud with no problems.  I bought the lenovo machine attracted  by the larger screen and although I did expect top of the line performance but instead decent functionality from 4GB of ram and newer OS ( Billy G. product #8 LOL). Out of the box, the system took forever to boot up, and once running it was way slower than my Atom Celeron running XP. Disipointed, I took the makine back toi best buy to service it. They test IT (realy??) and returned the junk to me saying it was fine. I had an original XP CD and I tried to downgrade to XP hoping that I will improve system speed. Not only I did not improove speed but I did not have sound nor full resolution and wireless due to the missing drivers. I called lenovo and they wanted me to pay $150 for technical support over the phone. As a list option had to install Ubuntu to have souund but the system is still ridiculosly slow. In conclusion: a year later I did not use the laptopm more than 10-15 hours and those were only to try to fix it. Never buy Lenovo again and shop best buy. Stay away from this garbage.

Reviews.Title: Cant go wrong with Lenovo!
Reviews.Author: Dowjonez7
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my son. It's been great....so far. I love using windows 8 but, the keyboard layout is counterintuitive. I just connect a keyboard and mouse and we are set. Great price as well.

Reviews.Title: it crashed
Reviews.Author: lola
Reviews.Content: This product is fine! It starts up really quickly, it's easy to get used to. Windows 8 is really odd and I dislike it. Other than that...my laptop has crashed 4 times in one week! I don't know if it was dropped or something, but something is definitely off. I'm contacting Lenovo about it. So beware.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Hillary Brown
Reviews.Content: No regrets on the purchase. This laptop delivers what was expected, it is my new personal toy. Not willing to share.

Reviews.Title: Excelent!
Reviews.Author: Geovany M.
Reviews.Content: Very good shipping and handling services .Very is quality product!I am very happy with this purchase!You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: Supplier qualification and its product
Reviews.Author: Saul
Reviews.Content: they are trusted, the product works!I did not like the processor speed (in the box and the computer says it's not dual core)I have also one desktop pc lenovo thinkcentre a55 cpu intel 2.4 ghz dual-core 2 gb ram 230 gb hard diskin terms of product quality is not completely covered my expectations for reasons of speed of cpu

Reviews.Title: Lenovo G585 Laptop
Reviews.Author: Ramon V. Pastrick
Reviews.Content: Works as a computer should with no problems. The Big downside is Windows 8. You'll have to relearn how to use a computer all over again. I've been using computers for 25 years and have been professionally trained but it took me 20 minutes just to figure out how to reboot it. One thing that is annoying is the left mouse (touch pad) button. It takes effort to push it down and it should be just a light tap. What is with these touch pads the last few years? You touch it wrong and the screen gets huge or tiny! This is a regular laptop with NO touch screen.

Reviews.Title: lenovo G585
Reviews.Author: Rafael Arevalo
Reviews.Content: un excelente equipo con un precio accesible, con todas las características de lenovo, excelente en todo sentido recomendado 100% gracias.

Reviews.Title: Lenova G585
Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter for school and she likes it, however, sometimes has trouble with getting online.  However, this may be due to her AT&T; connection which never really works like it's supposed to in the first place.  So, can't  blame the computer entirely.  Anyway, she has no major problems with anything concerning the operations and works of the Lenovo.

Reviews.Content: very short battery life less than 2 hours  windows 8 is a piece of trash does not work the way the youtube tutorial instructions say cant find a single tech person who can operate windows 8 has windows updates every day cant find any improvement gonna have windows 8 removed from computer and find a working system that is user friendly  DO THE WORLD A FAVOR AND SCRAP WINDOWS 8 and everything associated with it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: I have to watch YouTube videos on my IPad!
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Hill "Major Rassendyll"
Reviews.Content: Let's be straight.  I don't have a problem with the hardware.  However the Windows 8 Operating System is absolutely the worst piece of garbage in the history of personal computing.  I've had over thirty years experience with PCs.  I am an electrical engineer.  My IQ is high enough for Mensa and I can barely figure this machine out.First in order to watch most videos, I have to use my iPad!  I keep getting messages to update my Adobe flash but supposedly this is part of Windows 8.  There is a workaround process online but I can't get it to work.  Microsoft released an OS that gives an error message that I am supposed to ignore.  Would any of us buy a new car with a red light lit on the dashboard?  Would any of us listen to a salesman who told us "Nevermind the light!"  What nitwit authorized the release of this product?If you look at it funny, the computer switches between screens and applications.  It doesn't have the familiar Start button at the bottom left of the desktop. I had to purchase Microsoft Office separately.  However I haven't figured out how to put the icons on the desktop.  So I have to open an existing Excel file then create a new spreadsheet once Excel has started.  So now I have to push the car to get it going!Turning off the machine is equally counter-intuitive.  Continuing with the car analogy, I have put my feet through the floorboards !  Who designed this ?  Fred Flintstone?I think the problem with Windows 8 is it is a one size fits all hybrid.  It is also designed to work on tablets and touchscreens.  This computer is not a tablet and it does not have touch screens.  This makes navigation and functionality difficult.  I have different shoes for different activities.  In Microsoft's view of the computing world, I wear the same shoes for hiking, basketball and formal occasions.  In order for this hybrid to work, MS completely re-arranged the dashboard.Where is Bill Gates when we need him?I selected a Lenovo because I had used one for years at work with no problem.  But those machines were Windows 7.  They were also carefully imaged by my corporate IT department.  Lenovo has put plenty of their own advertising on my computer. I even get pop-up advertisements when I don't want them.  I'm going to have to find out how to turn these off by data-mining the Internet.  I'll use my iPad.Do not buy any computing hardware that incorporates Windows 8.  You setting yourself up for decreased productivity and greatly increased frustration.

Reviews.Title: Bad Computer
Reviews.Author: lisa m krautheim
Reviews.Content: The computer came came with Microsoft not working, so I had to send it back..sucks I was really liking this but didnt work out.
